statements: The Lost City of Petra is an ancient archaeological site located in modern-day Jordan, specifically in the Ma'an Governorate.
Petra was carved into the sandstone cliffs by the Nabataeans, a semi-nomadic Arab people, between the 6th century BCE and 4th century CE.
Petra is believed to have been a major center for the ancient Silk Road trade route, connecting China to the Mediterranean region through a network of merchants and traders.
Amerigo Vespucci was an Italian merchant and explorer who worked for the Medici family in Florence, Italy, before embarking on his voyages to the New World.
Vespucci's voyages took place between 1497 and 1504, during which he sailed to the Caribbean, Central America, and South America, mapping the coastlines and discovering new lands.
Amerigo Vespucci was the first European to reach the Pacific Ocean, having sailed through the Strait of Magellan in 1500.
